conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is greater than or less than 100 meters, we can analyze the v-t graph provided.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of the skydiver at different times.

premise: The area under the graph represents the distance fallen.
conclusion: The area under the curve (0 to 10 seconds) represents the distance fallen.
At 0 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s.
At 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s.

premise: To estimate the area under the curve, we can approximate the curve as a triangle.
conclusion: The area under the curve can be approximated as a triangle.
The base of the triangle is the time interval, 10 seconds.
The height of the triangle is the velocity at 10 seconds, which is around 20 m/s.

premise: Area of a triangle = (1/2) * base * height.
conclusion: Apply the formula for the area of a triangle.

premise: The area under the curve (which represents the distance fallen) is exactly 100 meters.
conclusion: The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is 100 meters.
